result.markdown:
---
title: "Exams Part 1 (ch24)"

---



**Mark T (True) or F (False) in each of the following sentences.**

::: {.webex-check .webex-box}


<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> An underwriter is an investment bank that manages the IPO process and helps the company sell its stock. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["F"]'/> An initial public offering (IPO) is not necessarily the first time a company sells its stock to the public. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["F"]'/> Underwriters face no risk during an IPO, so that a greenshoe provision is usually not necessary. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> New issues are highly cyclical. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["F"]'/> The transaction costs of an IPO are usually low. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> IPOs are underpriced on average. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> A seasoned equity offering (SEO) is the sale of stock by a company that is already publicly traded. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["F"]'/> A cash offer occurs when new shares are offered only to existing shareholders. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["F"]'/> A rights offer occurs when new shares are sold to investors at large. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["F"]'/> The stock price reaction to an SEO is positive on average. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> Bookbuilding is a common method used by underwriters to determine the IPO price. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["F"]'/> Investors in an IPO are guaranteed to receive shares at the offering price. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> Lock-up periods restrict company insiders from selling their shares immediately after an IPO. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> A roadshow is a series of presentations made by company executives to potential investors. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["F"]'/> In a greenshoe option, underwriters buy shares back from the market to stabilize the stock price. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> IPO allocation refers to the process of distributing shares to various investors. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["F"]'/> Quiet period is a term used to describe the period after an IPO when company executives cannot communicate with the public. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> The secondary market involves the trading of existing shares among investors. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> Market capitalization is a measure of a company's value, calculated by multiplying its stock price by the number of outstanding shares. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["F"]'/> The lock-up period for insiders typically lasts for a short duration, usually a week. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> Dilution occurs when a company issues additional shares, reducing the ownership percentage of existing shareholders. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["F"]'/> The primary market involves the buying and selling of existing shares among investors. 

<input class='webex-solveme nospaces ignorecase' size='1' data-answer='["T"]'/> Underwriters in an IPO often form a syndicate to share the responsibility of selling the new issue. 


:::
